fields.headline: Fuzzy logic
fields.bodyText: Tony Shaw confuses existentialists and beatniks (Letters, June 18). The Beats were Americans who only received the derogatory coinage "beatnik" in San Francisco in 1958; the term "beatnik" went global when a record of that title was a hit for The Champs in 1959. The fuzzy, unacademic Beat philosophy, evolving into hippydom, saved the world from nuclear extinction, according to the funkmeister George Clinton, whereas academic existentialist Martin Heidegger had Nazi connections. DBC Reed Thorplands, Northants
